title: Moving charge - voltmeter across a conductor

content.question: A rectangular metallic conductor is connected by copper wires in series with a battery and a switch as shown. The conductor lies within a region containing a uniform magnetic field directed into the page. A voltmeter is connected across points <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> such that if Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is at a higher potential, the voltmeter will read a positive value. With the switch open, the voltmeter reads <math alttext="0 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>. A short time after the switch is closed what is the sign of the value the voltmeter reads?

choices.label: A value alternating between positive and negative

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
